title: How to Make a Cream Cheese and Peanut Butter Dip

steps.headline: On a cutting board, use a knife to cut the block of cream cheese in a half.
steps.description: Put the other half in a bowl and wrap it with plastic wrap. Put it in the fridge and use it next time.

steps.headline: Have your cream cheese sit under room temperature for about thirty minutes to get soft.
Once the cream cheese has finished softening, use an electric mixer to mix the cream cheese on medium speed.
Stop the mixer and add the peanut butter, milk and honey.
Mix again until the mixture is completely smooth.
Put the dip in a bowl and have it stay in the fridge for half an hour to chill.
Once the dip has finished chilling, use your dippers to dip and start eating.

text: On a cutting board, use a knife to cut the block of cream cheese in a half. Put the other half in a bowl and wrap it with plastic wrap. Put it in the fridge and use it next time. Have your cream cheese sit under room temperature for about thirty minutes to get soft.  Once the cream cheese has finished softening, use an electric mixer to mix the cream cheese on medium speed.  Stop the mixer and add the peanut butter, milk and honey.  Mix again until the mixture is completely smooth.  Put the dip in a bowl and have it stay in the fridge for half an hour to chill.  Once the dip has finished chilling, use your dippers to dip and start eating.
